item.title: Post Mortem 2021
item.description: Performance My 2021 time-weighted return was 28.9%, putting me squarely in the who-gives-a-fuck category. I got lucky and it could’ve been much worse, as I pretty much lost my marbles during the GME saga and made some speculative greedy bets that ended up evaporating about 30% of my portfolio.

item.title: What I Learned in 2021
item.description: Don’t be an ideologue Keep religion and dogma out of your financial decisions.

item.title: Thanksgiving 2021
item.description: Today was a rough day on the markets. A new variant has been detected in South Africa, and it seems to be a vicious one with a lot of mutations in the right (or wrong, depending how you look at it) places.

item.title: Quotes (growing)
item.description: A wise man’s life is based around FUCK YOU. The Gambler You know how I stayed alive this long, all these years?

item.title: DeBABAcle
item.description: $BABA have released their earnings, and the market didn’t like them. I didn’t look into the details of it, but basically growth and margin have slowed down in their core commerce business due to competitive pressures.

item.title: BC Floods
item.description: UPDATE (2021-11-29) Looks like I was wrong on the lumber supply crunch…I confused lumber production with lumber transportation.

item.title: Resources for Value Investors
item.description: This list is by no means intended to be comprehensive, and it will most likely grow with time.

item.title: Maxing Out Positions
item.description: Just read this fantastic post from Kuppy. I absolutely love how he discards all the unpredictable and risky stuff that sometimes passes for desirable asymetry, whereas it’s just unknowable shit that could go either way.

item.title: Portfolio Update - October 2021
item.description: This month was a good one. My best year-to-date, actually. I don’t show my returns anymore, at least not month to month.

item.title: Solar Incentives
item.description: One of my favorite side-benefits of investing is that it incentivizes me to learn more about topics that I might not have been interested in otherwise.

item.description: These are some notes I took listening to a CO/nversations podcast episode featuring Artem Fokin, from Caro-Kann Capital LLC.

item.title: DWAC - Trump's Social Media Company
item.description: Trump announced this Wednesday October 20th that his new company called Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG) would merge with a SPAC called Digital World Acquisition Company (DWAC), with the purpose of creating a new social media (similar to Twitter) called “Truth”.

item.description: How did I hear about this company? Someone on CommonStock shared that they were down 60% on the stock.

item.title: Portfolio Update - August 2021
item.description: US-listed stocks now represent 22.9% of the portfolio, up from 22% the previous month. Although there are certainly some good opportunities in the US market, I have no appetite for more $USD exposure at the moment.

item.title: Investing Approach
item.description: Update (2021-09-08) I was trying a bit too hard when writing this post. In a sense, that’s to be expected when one is still trying to find their style.

item.title: Adam Robinson on The Business Brew
item.description: Notes from an awesome podcast episode of The Busines Brew, featuring Adam Robinson. This one was not easy to digest, as Adam touches on A LOT of topics.

item.title: Thoughts on the pandemic and the vaccine
item.description: UPDATE (2021-12-09) To boost or not to boost If you’ve been following me and reading my crazy midnight tweets, you know I was hesitant to vaccinate initially (because of unknown risks), but I did it after some time.

item.title: Portfolio Update - July 2021
item.description: Comments US-listed stocks (including $BABA) now represent 22% of the portfolio. $NUR.CN is still weighing heavily on the performance.

item.title: Key Principles for Investing and Life
item.description: Webcast featuring William Green (@williamgreen72), Guy Spier (@GSpier) and Matthias Knab (@MatthiasKnab). I have read and greatly benefitted from Guy Spier’s wonderful book “The Education of a Value Investor” and have just received William’s highly praised “Richer, Wiser, Happier”, which is next on my reading list.

item.title: Circle of competence vs shameless cloning
item.description: The concept of circle of competence is well known in the investing community. I believe it was popularized by Warren Buffet, at least that’s how I first came accross it.

item.title: Portfolio Update - May 2021
item.description: This month’s positive performance was driven mainly by CTS.TO which has been a great holding so far (up more than 100% since first purchase), and NUR.

item.title: Data Communications Management
item.description: Bottom line up front I am not taking a position in DCM as of today. While the stock is cheap in terms of multiples, the company is in the declining printing business and they need a mini-miracle to expand out of it into digital.
